Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery krater or dinos; interior glazed (fired reddish); exterior: from top, black-figure decoration consisting of possible hind leg and part of underbelly of mammal to right; below, head and one front paw of panther to right; head, neck with added red and one front leg of goat to left; below, undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From same vase as Oxford, Ashmolean Museum G128.16.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1184)
